text: Didn't work out decided to go a different route. Have cash on hand. No real complaints.

name: Anthony Hamilton
text:
Update: 5 months in and the gates are sagging

They were 1.5 hrs late. They talked us into putting toppers on our posts, but they cut the posts too short to put toppers on and have refused to replace them. multiple toppers are below the fenceline! The fence still has green spray paint on it from the store. They talked us into arched tops-- which turned out terribly uneven/non-symetrical. There are overcuts everywhere. The arch on the frontside of the fence doesn't light up with the backside (of the same panel) of the fence. Every cut is splintered and jagged. They have nice gates and they are balanced well. They have refused to fix the issues. I hope we don't have to escalate this.

name: Eddie Graves
text:
June 18th crew arrived to start demolition.  I was informed the entire job would take 3 days.  Equipment issue occurred, and work stopped.  Day 2 (6/19)  Remainder of fence taken down, then the next problem.  It was originally agreed existing posts would be extracted and new posts installed to avoid damages to sprinkler system.  Their removal system was not working, so I agreed to let them saw existing posts to ground level.   Day 3 (6/20) Remaining posts set and cross beams are up.  Work to begin installing pickets but no pickets available.  How can you have a job scheduled, know lumber needed,  and not have purchased in advance?  The company had received half payment for job.  Day 4 (6/22)  Pickets have been purchased,  Sprinkler system has been damaged and needs repaired.  Company paid repair.  The gentleman sawing the posts to the same height of the top of fence was not as tall as the 6’ fence.  This resulted in posts being sawed off at an angle, and numerous adjacent boards were marred because of the chain saw.  In addition, boards were split, some boards sawed into, and others were installed without using a level.  I had 2 gates installed and neither were up to the standards that I expected.  Day 5 (6/23) Finally the finish line.  My wife noticed a couple of small things that needed attention.  The supervisor was not very receptive to her concerns and seemed agitated she would question the workmanship.  We felt they were rushing to get to the next job.  I could not stand over each employee to see that the work was being done properly.  This falls under responsibility of the job supervisor.   I raised these issues with the rep.   On June 25th, rep came out and inspected  issues in question and agreed our issues were not to their company standards.   On a text dated July 7th, I was assured these “touch ups” would be taken care of and owner had approved necessary repairs.  Almost two weeks later, the crew came out to make  repairs.  They should have known materials needed for this appointment, but once again, the needed materials were not in their possession.  I told them “no problem”, get the lumber and come back in a couple of days.    I texted the rep after they had gone to inform him of the problem, and  was told it would be rescheduled in a few days.  After several texts to reschedule, I finally heard back on July 31st.  I was then informed the “touch ups” were NOT warranted, and no further action from the company.  So, for 24 days I was misled regarding the repairs.
Would I recommend Helena Fence and Deck?  NO.
1.	You do not know if they will be on the job early enough to finish on time because they must get supplies for the day’s work.  If the stores do not have the needed materials, then your job will be on hold until store is resupplied.
2.	You would need to inspect all the work as it is being done, because  lack of follow-up to repair any issues that are discovered after they have gone.
3.	One of the supervisors on job is not receptive to suggestions, therefore making it difficult to communicate while the work is being performed.

name: Timothy Christian
text: They responded fast prior to installation and had quick availability. The crew was nice but the quality and repairs after installation don't justify a 20% premium over others in the area. For instance they installed pavers on the side of the house for our garbage and recycling bins to rest on but they didn't use leveling sand or joint compound. The individual pavers would wobble. I had to removed all the pavers and re-install them correctly. Currently our side gate flexes when you open and closes, they tried to repair the gate two times. It's still not completely correct and the repairs were sloppy. Communicating with the owner is difficult, I will probably pay another company to repair the door correctly and fix an unsecured post. Overall I'm not fully pleased.

name: Betty Sexton
text: I have a Beautiful deck.!  Brian Barnes & crew got the job done.  Good price, good people. Definitely I would recommend Helena Fence & Deck!

name: Greg Robinson
text:
I worked with Cole Jones in getting a quote for our roof.  Cole was responsive, on time, and thorough with his appointment, inspection and sitting down with us about the condition of the roof and options for a roof replacement.

Sandy followed up with scheduling the roof replacement and all the paperwork which was in fantastic order.

Blair showed up on the job, arranged for good weather (just kidding) and did what they said they would do when they said they would do.

The knowledge, expertise and quality was evident at the end and we are very satisfied with our roof.  It has been four months and not a single leak and they also replaced our gutters.

It was a pleasure working with them.

name: Ian Thomas
text:
We had a great experience with Blair. I did my homework and got quotes from 5 other companies, but Blair blew us away with their authenticity, local roots and competitive pricing. After getting a lot of quotes, it was clear that at our price point, all the windows were essentially the same quality with the same bells and whistles; it was the install that would really make or break the project.

I was confident that our windows would be installed correctly and if any issues were to come up, that Blair would resolve them. The install went smoothly, a little over a month after buying. We had metal windows and the guys took the time to cut them out by hand and ensure our new windows went in seamlessly. Instead of just throwing up wood surrounds, they capped the windows with custom aluminum before sealing it all up.

From beginning to end, Craig Blair was very patient in walking through everything with us and ensuring we were informed and comfortable. I feel very confident in being able to receive service if anything goes wrong in the future. I highly recommend Blair.

resp.text: Thanks Ian. Our pleasure.

name: J Baker
text: I contacted Blair Exteriors to replace the roof on my home.  I was terribly disappointed.  They almost destroyed our beautiful scrubs, which had been growing for 15 years, by throwing the old shingles off the roof onto our scrubs.  It will take years to get them back to form.  Instead of having brackets for their ladders they placed their ladders against our gutters scrapping the paint and bending the gutters.  On top of that I noticed the workers standing on the gutters.  I reported this to Dan Aycock, the Blair representative, and when he finally came by the house all he talked about was how he was going to do something about this in the future.  They had the highest quote, but I wanted to support a local business and felt I would get a better job.  I hate that I am writing this, but others should be aware.  J K Baker

resp.text: Hey Mr Baker, I spoke with Dan and the installation crew about the issues you experienced. I want to first thank you for your business and apologize for the issues. This is not the experience we want to leave any customer  with. I believe our office staff has already reached out to you but if you need anything please reach back out to us. Reviews like this help us see where to improve. Thanks

name: Kelly Horwitz
text: In an age when everyone seems to have a bad story about finding a contractor, Blair Exteriors is a breath of fresh air.  We needed a new roof - a project I was dreading. Blair made it easy and efficient. They are the consummate professionals. They arrived on time and worked until the sun set to get our roof on in a single day. Then they returned the next day to make sure everything was fully cleaned up. Make them your first call when you need work done on your house!

name: Brandon Thompson
text: Blair replaced my roof last year and had an issue a year later that was not their fault but they were quick to help get it resolved. Great company and great staff. Russel was very helpful.

name: Hillary Cherry
text:
The salesperson contacted me and set up my appointment.  When he called the day of my appointment he stated he lived in Hueytown and did not want to travel an hour across town nor he did he want to drive an hour an half back home.  He then gave me an out of this world number and when I told him we received quotes much lower he said go with them.  How rude! For a company to have 4.8 stars out of 5 one would expect better customer service.

11/1/19:  I am upgrading my review to 3 stars.  I was contacted by the Director of Marketing at Blair Exteriors and he was very apologetic about my situation.  My husband and I would like to personally thank you and your team for reaching out to us and taking care of this situation.  This shows your commitment to providing excellent customer service.  We will definitely reconsider using your services in the future.  Again, thank you.

resp.text: We would be happy to work with you on a future project. Thank you for taking our call and letting us make it right!

name: David Counts
text:
Sales:  Jay was most informative.  Shared many options with us and respected our budget limitations.  He was never "pushy". Was able to find some affordable customization opportunities for us also.  He kept in touch throughout the process, not just after the sale was made.

Financing:  Jay also shared some financing options that were most helpuf.

Products;  We purchased new windows, siding for the entire home, gutters, and chimney caps. Everything looks great.  With the new windows and the additional insulation wrap that come with the siding, our electric bill has already shown an improvement (even with all the 90+ days we have had).

Workcrews:  Russell, the project manager kept us up to date for the times the different crews (one for the windows and siding, one for the gutters, and one for the chimney caps) would come by and kept us up-to-date with the progress of each crew.  The work was accomplished much faster than we anticipated.  The crews were professional,well versed in their craft, unfailingly polite, and were very careful to check with us for anything out of the ordinary before proceeding.  They answered any questions that we had and they were also very careful with their clean up everyday.

Bottom Line:  I would recommend Blair and commend them for their excellent service.

name: Nancy Prater
text: Love my beautiful new roof!  All my neighbors are talking about the efficiency of the crew.  They can't believe it was a one day project.  Everyone arrived on time and worked safely. Excellent support staff in the office setting up the installation date and selecting the matching shingles!

resp.text: Thank you! We have some of the best crews! Your roof looks amazing!

name: Brandon Parker
text: We were really pleased with the quality and professionalism of Blair Exteriors. Our roof looks really great and the crew was very polite. Thanks for doing such a stand up job!

resp.text: We strive to provide every customer with exceptional customer service.

name: Sarah Shelton
text: I have used Blair Remodeling for three projects. I have used them to remodel a shower, seal the shingles on my house and to finish an existing shed. The work looks incredible. The best part about this company was that when we gave them a budget they were able to come up with a way to do the work within budget. We will hire Blair for any future projects we have. We would highly recommend this company to anyone.

name: David Shepherd
text: We chose Blair to replace 29 wood windows with very nice modern vinyl windows - low e gas, double hung, reflective coating, etc. The sales team was patient, knowledgeable, respectful, and above all honest. The pricing was a very fair value for what we purchased. The installers were great to work with. Courteous, professional, & thorough. They took their time to do it right the first time and were focused on the job before them NOT trying to get to the next job! The exterior trim work was exceptional. Everything the salesman told me would be done was completed by the installers without me having to bird dog them to do it. Very happy we chose Blair.

resp.text: We are thrilled that you are excited about how your window project turned out! Thank you for sharing your experience.

name: Elizabeth Williams
text: Blair Remodeling did a great job restoring my house. My house was built in 1952 so it was very important to me to preserve the old world charm of the house. Blair Remodeling replaced wood siding with James Hardie plank siding. They were able to match and install new windows that are identical to those that were original to the house. They also replaced the roof. All of this was done without jeopardizing the character of the house and preserving the integrity of the structure. I will definitely use them again for future remodeling projects.

name: Brandon Quick
text: Blair put on a new roof on our house after we discovered hail damage.  They were a pleasure to work with through the entire process.  They helped us pick out a new color and helped us decide on the GAF golden pledge warranty.  The roof installation crew took time to answer my questions and did a great job.  They were courteous and cleaned up after themselves.   The new roof looks great and I am glad I went with the color change.  They were a little slow getting to my last post installation punch list item but my overall experience with Blair was positive and they did what they said they would do and did a top quality job.  I would use them again and highly recommend them.

name: TriceUA
text: I had previously wrote a review stating issues I had with the windows I had purchased from Blair due to leaking problems and would like to revise my previous review. The leak issue was finally fixed from another contractor and the windows that Blair installed for me were never the issue. They actually remained in excellent condition! My contractor said it was amazing that the windows weren't damaged at all because of the leak; which was due to poor trim and frame installation of Signature Homes. The quality and craftmanship of Blair Windows is top notch and I recommend them to anyone!

resp.text: I want to thank you for the newest review of Blair. We will always be there to help our customers. Thank you for being a Blair customer.

name: Randy Moon
text: Superior sales staff. Excellent installers. Wonderful office staff. You will not regret working with these people.

resp.text: Thanks Randy! I hope you enjoy your new deck with family and friends.

name: Casey OQuinn
text: Can't say enough about the team at Blair.  They are without a doubt the most professional craftsmen around.  From start to finish the job was extremely smooth.  They show up when they say they will and the new windows we had installed are worth every penny and look fantastic.  Extremely happy with the results and I highly recommend Billy and his team!!

name: James Wilson
text:
Blair Remodeling replaced 26 of my old wooden double hung windows with Wincore vinyl windows.  I first met with Craig Blair on April.  He gave me a quote that same day.  He was very patient and was definitely not in a hurry to leave, even though it was late in the day.  He answered all of my questions.  After I thought about it for a while he came back another afternoon to answer more questions and show the demo window unit to my wife.  Again, very patient and in no hurry to be anywhere.

Made down payment in April.  He said they would install in early June.  That is exactly what happened.  The install took only three days.  They started on a Wednesday and finished on a Friday.  The install crew consisted of three guys.  They were extremely polite and cleaned up their mess each day.

There was only one major issue.  There were streaks and smudges on every window.  It looked like some kind of sealant that was not cleaned off during the manufacturing process.  I met with the lead installer on Friday morning and pointed this out to him and asked that he clean the windows.  He was very condescending and obviously did not want to clean the windows.  He said he would but I knew he would not.  I went back to work (my wife was home but said she would not enforce the window cleaning)

The project was finished when I got home Friday afternoon.  The windows looked great but . . . You guessed it.  There were still streaks and smudges on all the windows.  Not wanting to be a pain, I tried cleaning the windows myself.  The sealant was very difficult to remove.  It would not come off with glass cleaner alone.  I decided this should definitely be Blair’s responsibility.

I asked for a meeting with Criag Blair.  We met the following week.  He was very polite and patient.  He agreed to have the windows cleaned and address a few other minor issues.

It took a while, and to be fair, I was out of town for a week but we finally coordinated on having the windows cleaned.  The crew that did the installation came back out.  They came while I was at work.  My wife was home but declined to be the inspector.  They finished cleaning about 3 PM.  They waited for me to get home at 4:30.  We walked around and inspected all 26 windows.  There were a few touch ups but for the most part they did a good job.

In summary, I was very pleased and satisfied with the entire process.  I will definitely use Blair Remodeling in for any future projects.  Craig Blair is the best.  I totally trust him and I know that he will do whatever is necessary to make sure I am satisfied.  Hopefully, Blair will add cleaning the windows to their standard installation procedure.

text: I originally called Handymen, LLC to remove the carpet in my garden room and to replace it with bamboo tile...Two days before the project began, I cut the carpet and discovered old painted hardwood boards in perfect condition...I sent pictures to David Stewart, the General Contractor, and he didn't mind quickly changing plans so that we could preserve the beauty of these 74 year old floors...The before and after pictures are below...Simply amazing...David Stewart made my dreams come true...His ideas are unique and he tailors everything according to your requests...All work was impeccably done...And David had the proper permits from the City of Mobile...If you have any dreams of what you may want done, David Stewart will make it happen...And all of his work is done to code...He will keep you apprised all along the way as to true expectations in remodeling or repair and pricing...There were no surprises with invoicing...Handymen, LLC will be doing all of my future projects...They are very trustworthy and they clean up after the job is done...The Highest Quality Work I Have Ever Seen...

name: Justin Lancaster
text:
A year ago or so, me and my wife just finished building our new house and decided that we wanted a good privacy fence to compliment it. The fence was to help provide a nice private backyard space for us and to give our dogs a nice place to run around.

I started doing some research to see who might be best for tackling this job. I had previously done business with Lowe's and their fencing contractors and was quite pleased with their work. So, they were naturally in the running. About the same time I was talking to Lowe's to bid this out I found a close family friend that highly recommended Reidar and his crew at All Around Fence Company.Within a couple of weeks I had pricing from several contractors but only had my eyes set on Lowe's and All Around Fence. All Around Fence was 2x as high as Lowe's but after speaking with Reidar I thought that they would have a superior product. We agreed on a price of almost $8000 for this and within a few weeks we had a wonderful fence. That's about where the positive comments end.

Within a couple of months I had boards warping so bad I you could see straight through them. Some of the gates started warping etc. I was starting to question this wood was even pressure treated lumber. I am still not 100% sure on this today. More on that later. Anyways as soon as I started noticing problems I called Reidar and texted him multiple times. After several months I was able to get him out here to replace a few of the boards even though he showed up without my knowledge and then when I questioned whether he had been out here or not he just texted me that it was fixed. Well, some of them were but not all by any means. However, I let that go at the time because I figured I had a two year warranty and I would just wait to see if any more started turning and warping. And sure enough, we had more, lots more and the gates were still never looked at from the previous time. Fast forward to today and almost a year later I am still trying to get him to come out and fix this fence. Upon closer inspection it looks like the boards are placed too close to the ground, and in most cases they are in the ground which is causing them to wick up moisture which is no doubt causing the issues. I have had plenty of houses and plenty of fences and this is the first one we have ever had issues like this.

I understand that wood does some crazy things, but I have never in my life seen wood do this unless it wasn't treated. Remember, I am still not convinced that this is. So, with all of that being said, I cannot recommend this company to anyone. The work is not holding up, he doesn't communicate well, if at all, and it would seem the warranty means nothing. If this was Lowe's I guarantee you they would have already been out here and had replaced all of this stuff, no questions asked. I should have went with them instead because I know they stand behind their product and said they could have done this for $4000 roughly. I paid Reidar and his crew almost $8000 and this thing isnt holding up well at all. All I want is for him to stand behind his product and replace what needs to be fixed so that I can move on to staining this fence even though I am not sure it will help much as I would be surprised if I wasnt replacing this thing in a few years. The funny thing is, the fence at our old house is 10 years old and looks just as good as it did the day it was put up. Lowe's did that one and I spent almost a grand staining and sealing it. I am sure that has made a huge difference in itself but the fact is it just seemed to be a better built fence overall compared to this one. I can fix these issues myself but after paying All Around Fence almost $8000 I feel like I shouldn't have to. I hope Reidar reads this and we can come to a resolution on this and then maybe I can change this review, but as of right now I haven't had any contact from him after trying to get someone out here for almost a year. Again, there is no way I can recommend them at this time. Take your money somewhere else.

text: M. A. Jackson built me a screened pool enclosure and did an excellent job. The enclosure will also reduce pool maintenance/cleaning by eliminating falling and windblown debris, insects, frogs, etc. from entering the pool. Mr. Jackson and his entire team are friendly/courteous folks and are devoted to providing you with a quality product that you are completely satisfied with.

Just be patient as their crew is sometimes backed up with projects.  His guys are very respectful and friendly.

name: Susan Goodson
text: We met this company at a home show in Huntsville.  At that time, we were in the process of selling our home and from the feedback we received, folks were wanting lighter cabinets which is why we spoke to them.   Fast forward a few months.  I rec'd a call from the company following up from our contact.  I scheduled an appt. but told the caller we have since moved but the home we own now was in need of a kitchen re-model.  The appt. came and went and no one showed.  Come to find out, rep went to our old address ( I gave new address during the phone call)  I called them to reschedule.  Rep showed up at our home and that was the end of the beginning.  He did not listen to us.  We did no want re-facing but he continued to measure existing cabinets which we did no intend to keep.  I asked to look at the books he brought in.  He asked rather snarkily, have you checked out our website???  Yes, but since you have books can I look?  At the  end of a very awkward meeting, he said they have a designer that could help with what we want.  We have not heard anything from this company 4 months later.  The end.  Would not recommend this company.

name: Walter Fulton
text:
During recent Hurricanes Sally and Zeta my 8ft. Privacy Fence lost several large panels, and damaged others. I was in search of a fence building company to make the necessary repairs, when I noted such construction in progress at a nearby neighbor’s property. I closely observed the building of a privacy fence around the property and was impressed with the work ethics and quality of the finished product.
I made contact with the Crew Chief of the builders and learned it was All American Fence Builders.
I followed up with a request for an estimate for repair/replacement of my fence. Subsequently, considering the damage to, and age of, the entire fence,  I contracted for the complete rebuilding of
the entire length of the 8ft Privacy Fence.
I was highly and completely satisfied with the finished product. I couldn’t have asked for better quality and workmanship. As I commented to the Owner of the company, “It’s a Privacy Fence To Be Proud Of.”
As a result I would not hesitate to highly recommend ALL AMERICAN FENCE BUILDING to any property owner in need of such services. I would give it a 5 STAR RATING.

Walter Fulton
44 General Canby Drive
Spanish Fort, Al 36527

resp.text: Mr. Fulton, thank you so much for the outstanding review! It was our pleasure to build your fence. Thank you for your service to this country and God bless!

text: Jeff and his crew surpassed my expectations with the quality, affordability and timeliness of their work. They tore down and disposed of my old wood fence and built a new one with good quality materials (and gave me a warranty). resp.text: Thank you so much Ashley! We truly appreciate your kind words. I hope that you enjoy your new privacy fence for many years to come!

name: w.j. spin
text:
THEY ARE NOT BONDED AND DON'T PULL PERMITS!

I hired then to come build a fence. Unfortunately, the type of fence I asked for want allowed in my historic district. They assured me they were a reputable company and would pull the permits, deal with the water company, and has company. They never got the permits. Now the city is telling me if they had, then they would have been told that the specs were not allowed. They built the fence and I paid them cash. Because they aren't bonded, I am now responsible for taking down my fence and putting up another one. I all then to fix it and they said no.

text: They only concreted in the corner poles! After hurricane zeta I realized this is why my fence started to sag not even a year after it was built and now the majority of it has fallen down!

resp.text:
All the posts should be concreted.   Please call us back and we will look into this further.  We need the
address and last name.  Thank you

name: Stephen Karnes
text:
Fast High Quality Work at a Fair Price.

They completed my partial (2/3) fence replacement and it looks great.  Everything I asked for was completed the way I wanted it.  There was one issue with 4x4 posts and the soft ground not being able to hold the heavy gates up, and yes they were using concrete on all the posts.  Anyway, they came back out the following day and added 6x6 posts, which corrected the issue.  They did also have to mod the gate location and inset it a few feet into the back yard, which actually gives the gate a better look imo.  All debris was removed.  They even moved some dirt around to accommodate their fencing.  Very professional, very impressed.  May be the luck of the draw of which labor you get from them.

Note that they charge a minimum for a 100 ft of fence for a job.
